catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 206
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: unsigned; hilly landscape with four figures, a shrine in red-orange, and grazing oxen; gold covers majority of surface and is applied in powdered form, flakes, and strips; slivers of silver also present
medium: Ink, color, gold, and silver on gilded paper
object_name: Six-panel folding screen, one of a pair (left)
title: Scenes from the Tales of Saigyō
